Reference¶

dataprep.py¶

class isoplot.dataprep.IsoplotData(datapath)¶

Bases: object

Class to prepare Isoplot Data for plotting

Parameters

  • datapath (str) – Path to .csv file containing Isocor output data

  • isoplot_logger (child of logger class: 'logging.Logger') – Logger object

  • data (Pandas DataFRame) – Isocor output data before merge

  • template (Pandas DataFrame) – User-defined template containing conditions, times, replicate numbers, etc… before merge

  • dfmerge (Pandas DataFrame) – Dataframe containing merged data (template and isocor output). Is called by prepare_data method and used by Plot class

Raises

  • UnicodeDecodeError – Is raised by get_template method when template file is not .xlsx or encoding is not utf-8

  • AssertionError – return error if after merge data is not of tye DataFrame

generate_template()¶

Generate .xlsx template that user must fill

get_data()¶

Read data from csv file and store in object data attribute.

get_template(path)¶

Read user-filled template and catch any encoding errors

merge_data()¶

Merge template and data into pandas dataframe

prepare_data()¶

Final cleaning of data and export

plots.py¶

Module containing the plotting classes. The methods correspond to different types of plots to create

Bases: object

Class to create maps from Isocor output (MS data from C13 labelling experiments)

Create a clustermap of mean_enrichment data across all conditions & times & metabolites

Create a heatmap of mean_enrichment data across all conditions & times & metabolites

static split_ids(ids)¶

Function to split IDs and get back lists of conditions, times and replicates in order

Parameters

ids (list) – IDs generated by IsoplotData Object

Returns

lists containing conditions, times and replicates

isoplotcli.py¶

Isoplot2 cli module containing argument parser, cli initialization and main logger creation.

isoplot.isoplotcli.initialize_cli()¶

Initialize parser and call main function

isoplot.isoplotcli.main(args, logger)¶

Main function responsible for directory creation, launching plot creation and coordinating different modules. Can be put in a separate module if the need ever arises (if a GUI is created for example).

Parameters

  • args (list of arguments) – List of strings to parse. The default is taken from sys.argv

  • logger (class: 'logging.Logger') – main logger that will be derived in other modules

Raises

  • RuntimeError – if inputed destination path does not exist raises error

  • RuntimeError – if inputed template path does not exist raises error

utilities.py¶

isoplot.utilities.control_isoplot_map(args, data_object)¶

Function to control which map methods are called depending on the arguments that were parsed

isoplot.utilities.control_isoplot_plot(args, data_object, metabolite, conditions, times)¶

Function to control which plot methods are called depending on the arguments that were parsed

isoplot.utilities.get_cli_input(arg, name, data_object, logger)¶

Function to get input from user and check for errors in spelling. If an error is detected input is asked once more. This function is used for galaxy implementation

Parameters

  • arg (list) – list from which strings must be parsed

  • name (str) – name of what we are looking for

  • data_object (class: 'isoplot.dataprep.IsoplotData') – IsoplotData object containing final clean dataframe

  • logger (class: 'logging.Logger') – Logger object

Returns

Desired string after parsing

Return type

list

isoplot.utilities.get_local_cli_input(name, data_object, logger)¶

Function to get input from user and check for errors in spelling. If an error is detected input is asked once more. This function is used for local implementation

Parameters

  • name (str) – name of what we are looking for

  • data_object (class: 'isoplot.dataprep.IsoplotData') – IsoplotData object containing final clean dataframe

  • logger (class: 'logging.Logger') – Logger object

Returns

Desired string after parsing

Return type

list
